samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first official release in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names. R was developed as an implementation and extension of the S programming language, which was created at Bell Laboratories.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first official release in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names. R was developed as an implementation and extension of the S programming language, which was created at Bell Laboratories.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: The first official release of R (version 1.0.0) was made available on February 29, 2000. Prior to this, R had been in development since the early 1990s, with Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman starting the project around 1991-1992 at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

The first official release of R (version 1.0.0) was made available on February 29, 2000. Prior to this, R had been in development since the early 1990s, with Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman starting the project around 1991-1992 at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
